reviewText: Light entertainment without any political or moral message.  Lots of laughs
Has some funny parts but overall a time waster. The movie set up seems good at first but loses you by the end. Not enough funny to sustain you.
Sappy, difficult to understand, captions did not come up.
A grand old fashioned comedy that gets a chuckle a minute. A gentle blend of crime and church that endears the cast to the audience. We need more movies like this.
Dated but fun movie to watch

I am usually very good at understanding British but the accent in this movie was way beyond me.  Definitely a need for captions at least in some of the more difficult parts.  Must admit I didn't watch the entire movie.  I fell asleep half way through.  Evidently it wasn't amusing enough to catch my attention and keep me awake.  I'm not interested enough to try again.
Anyone who likes ealing comedies or carry on films will love this.

The three of us lasted about twenty minutes and then had to turn the Crooks In Cloisters off.  That was about ten minutes longer than it deserved.  Bad acting, unintelligible dialogue, and an unfunny comedy.
Funny and very enjoyable with great acting
An excellent very funny movie. Barbara Windsor is outstanding.

The British have always had their unique take on comedy. Just a fun, silly movie.
I just couldn't get through this dated, not classic film.
It is a fun 1960's tale that is full of delightful British street slang from that era.  The plot is ludicrous, but it does succeed in showing the merits of a simple life in England's island villages.
As much as I love British comedy, this movie fell short. Acting left much to be desired, weak plot with an abrupt and flat ending.
